metadata.synopsis: A Flaming Fist initially trying to put out the fires at Waukeen's Rest, an inn that was attacked by goblins and drow in the night. If the other Flaming Fists find a way inside, she stops to watch. After Desire escapes and the inn is burnt down, she investigates the area, kneeling and inspecting tracks.

5.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
5.text: You're no help just standing there. Help us!
5.context: NodeContext: <Standing.> Scooping water and throwing it on the fire.

13.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
13.text: Go away. It's hard enough reading these tracks without you stomping all over.

27.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
27.text: Can't you see the inn is burning?!  Help or get out of the way!
27.context: NodeContext: <Standing,> Trying to put out the fire

52.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
52.text: The tracks converge here. Two, maybe three drow. At least one of ours.

123.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
123.text: From here they went... Damn! It's all so confused.
123.context: NodeContext: Dain goes from kneeling to standing on "It's all so confused" - looking at the tracks on the ground in confusion

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Those tracks lead to Moonrise Towers.

41.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
41.text: What does it look like? I'm trying to sort out what happened here.

82.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
82.text: But I can't piece together much, thanks to the fire.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: I can tell you: the Grand Duke was taken to Moonrise Towers.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I can tell you: Grand Duke Ravengard was kidnapped.

81.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
81.text: How do you - oh, never mind. Half the Sword Coast probably knows by now.

115.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
115.text: The drow came for the Duke. Killed near everyone in the inn while they were at it.

131.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
131.text: At least his counsellor survived, thank the gods.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: I can tell you: the inn was raided by goblins and drow.

43.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
43.text: And torched the place while they were at it.

17.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
17.text: Drow and goblins raided the inn and burned it to the ground.

14.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
14.text: I'm trying to find out where they took the - what they came for.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: You're smart to keep quiet. Nobles attract the wrong sort of attention.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I'm a guard from a nearby village. I'm here to offer my assistance.

25.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
25.text: You, a guard? Huh. Have to admit, you are more than a little... threatening.

85.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
85.text: You, a guard? Gods, they must be desperate if they're hiring Underdark muscle.

92.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
92.text: Huh. Don't know how much help you can be, really.

71.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
71.text: Right. I don't think you hail from anywhere close by.

51.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
51.text: Right. And I suppose you saw the smoke from the Underdark?

106.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
106.text: I'll blame your little lie on simple curiosity. This time.
106.context: NodeContext: <Standing> Emphasis on 'simple' - she's calling the player stupid.

55.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
55.text: There aren't any villages within a day's walk.
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Narrows her eyes suspiciously.NodeContext: <Standing>

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Clearly you're in a rough spot. I can help.

54.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
54.text: Oh, damn it all. Half the Sword Coast probably knows by now.

60.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
60.text: The raiders kidnapped Grand Duke Ravengard of Baldur's Gate. Killed his entire guard while they were at it.

129.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
129.text: The Counsellor died, too. This has all gone to the hells.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Any idea where they took the Grand Duke?

47.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
47.text: There were drow here, so my best guess would be the Underdark.

34.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
34.text: And if they took him down there... Helm save him.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: They took the Grand Duke to Moonrise Towers.

114.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
114.text: The old fortress? Gods, that whole area is cursed.
114.context: NodeContext: <Standing> This is very bad news.

80.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
80.text: I'll pass it up the chain of command - whatever good it'll do for the Grand Duke.
80.context: NodeContext: <Standing> Shaking her head. This news has her spooked.

88.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
88.text: We'll stay put for now. Still might get something out of these tracks.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: It's a shame they left any survivors. That's poor form.

44.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
44.text: What in the Nine Hells is wrong with you?
44.context: NodeContext: <Standing> An outburst, but she catches herself and takes a deep breath.

133.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
133.text: Leave, before I put a sword through you.
133.context: NodeContext: <Standing> Through gritted teeth - she's trying desperately to remain calm

113.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
113.text: I appreciate the offer, but you'd just get in the way.

109.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
109.text: You should get going. And watch for goblins on the road.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: My true kin have no care for surface raids. You can trust me.

74.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
74.text: Hm. You haven't tried to slit my throat yet...
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: rer ecord notes. She was Recorded as kneeling, she should be standing <Greg>NodeContext: <Standing>

87.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
87.text: Can't really tell the difference between you lot, honestly.

23.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
23.text: You're in my way. Get moving.

110.speaker: Player
110.text: If they allied with goblins, they were not Lolth's Chosen. Tell me more - now.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: By my oath, you have my help. But I must to know the truth to assist you.

19.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
19.text: There's no need for any of that. Come on, stand up.
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Flaming Fist, exasperated, pulls them back to their feet.NodeContext: <Standing> A bit embarrased.

93.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
93.text: Oh, stand up. You're embarrassing yourself.
93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Flaming Fist, exasperated, pulls them back to their feet.NodeContext: <Standing> A bit curt.

98.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
98.text: We should've sent another dozen guards, at least. He's not just any noble, damn it!

78.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
78.text: What do you think you're doing? Stop that!

83.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
83.text: I'll blame that trick on simple curiosity. This time.

64.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
64.text: Your kind burned the inn to the ground. Even brought goblins along for the fun.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: Maybe you need a second pair of eyes. Want me to take a look?

40.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
40.text: By all means. Doubt you'll have much luck though.
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: rerecord notes. She should be standing for whole line.<greg>NodeContext: <Standing>

20.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
20.text: Most of the tracks were destroyed by the flames.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: You might as well give up.

73.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
73.text: And you should just bugger off.
73.context: NodeContext: <Standing.> She says this line EXTREMELY sarcastically.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: I'll see if I can spot anything.

31.speaker: Narrator
31.text: *You notice the tell-tale clumsiness of goblins, alongside something more light-footed - drow.*

75.speaker: Narrator
75.text: *Your gaze follows the drow footprints around the courtyard and south - out of the inn.*

108.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
108.text: That's something. But they could've gone south and then down - towards the Underdark.

42.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
42.text: We still have no idea where they took the - what they came for.

33.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
33.text: What'd I tell you? It's a godsdamned mess.

57.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
57.text: Be easier if you weren't bothering me.

96.speaker: Narrator
96.text: *The tracks are a chaotic mess. Gleaning any information from them is impossible.*

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Tracking is what I do. Let me see if I can spot anything.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: You're the one who seems confused.

68.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
68.text: These tracks should be able to tell us everything that happened here.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Wipe away the tracks with your foot.

9.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
9.text: Hey, HEY! Stop! You're destroying evidence!
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: PC swipes their foot on the ground, like they're wiping something up with it.NodeContext: <Standing>

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Ignore her - keep wiping away the tracks.

46.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
46.text: What in the Nine Hells did I just tell you?!

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Evidence for what? Surely you've pieced something together by now.

105.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
105.text: Watch where you step - these tracks might tell us where the raiders went.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: I found a pack of Zhentarim hiding nearby.

84.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
84.text: And? What do you expect me to do about it?
84.context: NodeContext: Goes from kneeling to standing

45.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
45.text: I don't have the Fists to take on a Zhentarim base. We're stretched thin as it is.
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: reshoot note:  Actor appears to have had a cold for this line only, doesn't match the VO of other lines. <Greg>NodeContext: <Standing>

49.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
49.text: Just stay out of their way and hope they stay out of yours.
